Class ClassicBattleAudioHelper

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.classicBattle.ClassicBattleAudioHelper
public final class ClassicBattleAudioHelper extends Object
Helper that centralises loading and lifecycle management for music and short sound effects used by the Classic Battle controller.

The helper tries to create JavaFX MediaPlayer instances for music assets (.wav or .mp3) and falls back to Clip for shorter sounds or when the JavaFX media subsystem is unavailable. It also exposes small lifecycle helpers that stop and dispose players/clips and return null to make caller-side replacement convenient (e.g. p = stopAndDispose(p)).

  • Constructor Details

    • ClassicBattleAudioHelper

      public ClassicBattleAudioHelper(Class<?> ctx)
      Create a new helper that resolves resources using the provided class's class loader. Passing null will cause the helper to use its own class for resource resolution.
      Parameters:
      ctx - class used as the resource owner; may be null

  • Method Details

    • stopAndDispose

      public static javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer stopAndDispose(javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer p)
      Stop and dispose the provided MediaPlayer if non-null.

      The method intentionally swallows exceptions to keep callers simple; it returns null so callers can assign the result back into their variable (convenience pattern used in this codebase).

      Parameters:
      p - player to stop and dispose
      Returns:
      always null

    • stopAndClose

      public static Clip stopAndClose(Clip c)
      Stop and close the provided Clip if non-null and return null for convenient reassignment.
      Parameters:
      c - clip to stop and close
      Returns:
      always null

    • stopMatchGameOverSound

      public void stopMatchGameOverSound()
      Stop any currently playing match "game over" sounds and release associated resources.

    • playMatchGameOverSound

      public void playMatchGameOverSound()
      Play the match "game over" sound. The helper first attempts to create and play a MediaPlayer. If that fails it falls back to a Clip playback. Exceptions during playback are swallowed to keep the call-site simple.

    • playMatchCountdownSound

      public void playMatchCountdownSound()
      Start the looping match countdown sound. Uses a MediaPlayer when available and falls back to a Clip.

    • stopMatchCountdownSound

      public void stopMatchCountdownSound()
      Stop any countdown sounds and release resources.
